parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To stone, cast stones (at), kill by stoning. From a compound of lithos and ballo; to throw stones, i.e. Lapidate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lay off or aside, renounce, stow away, put. From apo and tithemi; to put away.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
A young man, youth; a man in his prime (used even of a man of 40). From a derivative of neos; a youth.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
Saul, the apostle. Of Hebrew origin, the same as Saoul; Saulus, the Jewish name of Paul.
